availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: All of which Said Executions constitute by Law a portion of the Jury fund of the Henry Circuit Court,, And the Said C. M. Humston late Sheriff as aforesaid having failed to return Said Executions to the office whence they issued for thirty days after the return day thereof. He the Said Humston is hereby notified that on the first day of the next Aprile Term of the Henry Circuit Court I E P Thomas Trustee of the Jury fund as afsd in obedience to a Special order of this Court entered up at Term 18 will motion against you for Same in the name of the Commonwealth of Kentucky for the full amount of Said Execution ($2360.27c) together with Thirty percentum damage thereon and for all proper relief

I. Geo, T. Humston, Clerk of the Henry Circuit Court do Certify that the above is a true copy of the original petition & proceedings therein filed in the case of the Commonwealth of Kentucky vs C M Humston Late Sheriff of Henry County.

Witness My hand this 16" day September 1862
Geo. T. Humston C. H. C. C. C.
